metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3092 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The regex implementation in Google V8, as used in Google Chrome before 19.0.1084.46, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (invalid write operation) or possibly have unspecified other impact via unknown vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3092` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-browser-l10n - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-chromedriver - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5
No subscription required

notes.Note: mikesalvatore> The Ubuntu Security Team does not support libv8

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20.0.1132.47~r144678-0ubuntu5').
libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
